Coverage decreased (-0.01%) to 70.178% when pulling **5954e224a3f354bb6f3cd330ee1407db3fa5bd36 on reuvenlax:repeatable_bq_sink** into **15bd3a394e5c724216453a2098af117cac13778e on apache:master**.

Github makes it hard to see review comments when the code is updated. Repeating here:

> I thought for a while.
It is OK to be a failure. But we should be careful when one partition has some messages and others have no timestamp message that is greater than or equals to the target time.
  
The issue here is that API does not allow distinguishing these two cases : (a) missing timestamps vs (b) timestamp being already the latest.

How about trying to fetch offset for very old timestamp (may be timestamp '0') to see if it is (b). If that succeeds, we could start reading from latest offset.

If this sounds too hacky, I think it is ok to fail now even if only some of the partitions don't return an offset. I don't think we need to check every other partition here.
Please separate this into 2 PRs -- one for javadoc and one for autovalue. These are two separate features that should be judged independently.
Great, thanks! @hepeknet
Looks good to me, thanks @xumingming !
That is, unless we want to use __all__ do actually document the public API.

This will not make the first stable release, so will require some minor changes. Primarily:

The static method will not be removed, but instead deprecated. All SDK callers will be ported away from that method onto the introduced "validateComponentDeterministic" method.
